ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: I would be able to resist the urge to use (the drug): If I were angry at the way things had turned out.
I would be able to resist the urge to use (the drug): If I had trouble sleeping.
I would be able to resist the urge to use (the drug): If I remembered something good that had happened.
I would be able to resist the urge to use (the drug): If I wanted to find out whether I could use (the drug) occasionally without getting hooked.
I would be able to resist the urge to use (the drug): If I unexpectedly found some or happened to see something that reminded me of (the drug).
I would be able to resist the urge to use (the drug): If other people treated me unfairly or interfered with my plans.
I would be able to resist the urge to use (the drug): If I were out with friends and they kept suggesting we go somewhere and use (the drug).
I would be able to resist the urge to use (the drug): If I wanted to celebrate with a friend.

Notes: 1 = American Indian or Alaska Native; 2 = Asian; 3 = Black or African American; 4 = Native Hawaiian or Pacific Islander; 5 = White or Caucasian; 6 = More Than One Race; 88 = Unknown; 99 = Choose not to report
